User Agent: Opera/9.80 (Windows NT 5.1; U; de) Presto/2.9.168 Version/11.51

Steps to reproduce:

Account setting is pop3 with "leave messages on server" and "delete from server when deleted from inbox". This normally works as intended.
Mail server is pop.gmx.net
TB 6.0.2


Actual results:

When I detach or delete an attachment from a message in the inbox, at the next mail check this message is deleted from the server.


Expected results:

The message should be left on the server until it is actually deleted from the inbox. It should not be marked as to be deleted from the server when only the attachment is detached or deleted.
comments.author: wh_ng@gmx.de
comments.creator: wh_ng@gmx.de

comments.text:
(In reply to Wilfried Hennings from comment #0)
> The message should be left on the server until it is actually deleted from
> the inbox.

The original mail is actually deleted once from the Inbox during detatch/delete operation.
(i)  Original mail            : UIDL=uidl-a, offset=A.      size=nn KB
(ii) Mail after detech/delete : UIDL=uidl-a, offset=B(B>A), size < nn KB
After deach/delete, (i) is actually deleted from Inbox, so mail of UIDL=uidl-a is deleted from server.
This is currently same situation as duplicated mails by copy operation.
(1) Copy mail of UIDL=uidl-a, offset=A to other folder, copy back to Inbox,
    and repeat it.
- mail-1 : UIDL=uidl-a, offset=A, size=X
       |
- mail-N : UIDL=uidl-a, offset=A+(N-1)*X 
(2) Delete any duplicate => mail of UIDL=uidl-a is deleted from server.

> It should not be marked as to be deleted from the server when only the attachment is detached or deleted.

Agree with you.
If detach/delete, status in panacea.dat for UIDL=uidl-a shouldn't be changed from K(keep) to D(delete).
comments.author: m-wada@usa.com

I would be happy if TB would support
- leave messages on server
- do not delete after nn days
- do not delete if deleted from inbox (should circumvent the current bug)
AND
- add the possibility to selectively mark one or more messages for deletion (see bugs https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=263327 and https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=47297)

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:18.0) Gecko/18.0 Firefox/18.0 SeaMonkey/2.15a1 ID:20120902003005 c-c:ff603e79f92a m-c:3d9424eb6eb4

As a preliminary step, I'm changing account settings to
  [x] Leave messages on server
    [x] Until I delete them
for a_j_mechelynck@yahoo.co.uk which in normal times isn't much more than a spamtrap. Now as a second preliminary step let's forward something as attachment to there from one of my other accounts…

Hmm… The message was caught by one of my filters (when reading the Yahoo! mail server by POP), and now the Yahoo! webmail server tells me "You have no unread emails" and "There are no messages in your Inbox folder". I'll have to devise some variant of the test to have the message remain in my Inbox on SeaMonkey…

I have an idea: can you (not Wayne, who will also be caught by my filters, but, let's say, Wilfried) send me a message with an attachment, not at my Bugzilla address-of-record, but at a_j_mechelynck@yahoo.co.uk ? Thanks in advance.
